node.title: Convicted murderers' appeals rejected
node.description: Two people who tortured and murdered 17-year-old rough sleeper Dimetrius Pairama in 2018 have their appeals rejected.
node.content:
["The Court of Appeal has rejected bids from two people found guilty of kidnapping, torturing and murdering a teenage girl to overturn their convictions and sentences.", "", "
Kerry Te Amo and Toko Shane Rei Winter were found guilty of the murder of Dimetrius Pairama in 2019. Photo: RNZ / Cole Eastham-Farrelly
", "In a decision released today, the court dismissed the appeals of Toko Shane Rei Winter, also known as Ashley Winter, and Kerry Te Amo.", "The tortured body of 17-year-old rough sleeper Dimetrius Pairama, known as Precious, was found in a steel drum in the yard of an empty Māngere property in 2018.", "The following year, at a three-week trial in the High Court at Auckland, Te Amo and Winter were found guilty of her murder.", "The pair were jailed for life. Winter must serve at least 19 years and Te Amo 19 years and four months.", "A the pair's sentencing, Crown solicitor Natalie Walker said there was no good reason why they detained, tortured and murdered Pairama.", "Te Amo's appeal claimed a miscarriage of justice took place because a police interview was admitted as evidence despite him receiving incorrect advice about the maximum sentence he faced.", "Winter's appeal said no clear directions were given to the trial jury about evidence from someone granted immunity from prosecution.", "A teenager alleged to have been a third party in the crime was found unfit to stand trial."]
